Divine Controller.quote: Ishvara is the supreme controller, the body of consciousness whose cosmic body includes all beings. (Yoga Sutras 1:24)

Supreme Lord.quote: From fear of Him the wind blows, from fear of Him the sun rises. (Taittiriya Upanishad 2.8.1)

Universal Witness.quote: The Lord dwells in the hearts of all beings witnessing their actions. (Bhagavad Gita 13.23)

Cosmic Sustainer.quote: By whose command the moon and sun function, that alone is Brahman. (Kena Upanishad 1.1)

Divine Essence.quote: Ishvara is a special Purusha, untouched by afflictions, karma, fruition or their residue. (Yoga Sutras 1:24)

Divine Knowledge.quote: In Him is contained all knowledge. He is the source of time. (Shvetashvatara Upanishad 6.2)

Divine Grace.quote: By His grace alone do we attain the supreme peace. (Katha Upanishad 2.20)

Cosmic Order.quote: Through His power the universe revolves in order. (Shvetashvatara Upanishad 6.1)

Divine Manifestation.quote: All these forms are manifestations of the Supreme Lord. (Brahma Sutra 2.1.14)

Divine Will.quote: By His will all things move and have their being. (Kena Upanishad 1.4)

Divine Protection.quote: The Lord protects those who take refuge in Him. (Bhagavad Gita 9.31)

Divine Nature.quote: The Lord is the indwelling spirit of all beings. (Bhagavad Gita 18.61)

Divine Power.quote: His power is heard to be indeed diverse. (Shvetashvatara Upanishad 6.8)

Divine Creation.quote: From Him proceeds all creation, in Him it dissolves. (Mundaka Upanishad 1.1.7)

Divine Presence.quote: The Lord resides in the heart of all beings. (Bhagavad Gita 18.61)

Divine Attributes.quote: Omniscient, all-powerful, self-luminous is the Supreme Lord. (Shvetashvatara Upanishad 6.8)

Divine Law.quote: The Lord is the upholder of cosmic law and order. (Bhagavad Gita 9.10)

Divine Reality.quote: That which is One, the sages call by many names. (Rig Veda 1.164.46)

Divine Consciousness.quote: Pure consciousness, eternal and infinite is Ishvara. (Yoga Sutras Commentary 1:24)

Divine Energy.quote: By His energy the whole universe is illumined. (Katha Upanishad 2.2.15)

Divine Unity.quote: All this is indeed Brahman. (Chandogya Upanishad 3.14.1)

Divine Worship.quote: Through devotion alone can one know Me as I am. (Bhagavad Gita 18.55)

Divine Liberation.quote: By knowing Him alone one transcends death. (Shvetashvatara Upanishad 3.8)

Divine Path.quote: Those who meditate on Him become immortal. (Shvetashvatara Upanishad 3.10)

Divine Wisdom.quote: The wise see the Lord present in all beings. (Isha Upanishad 6)

Divine Sound.quote: The sacred syllable Om is verily the Lord. (Mandukya Upanishad 1)

Divine Form.quote: His form is not to be seen, no one sees Him with the eye. (Katha Upanishad 2.3.9)

Divine Time.quote: I am time, the great destroyer of worlds. (Bhagavad Gita 11.32)

Divine Freedom.quote: The Lord is ever free, untouched by any condition. (Yoga Sutras 1:24)

Divine Existence.quote: That which exists is One; sages call it by various names. (Rig Veda 1.164.46)
